result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin L Delaney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. Huber privileges for work, school and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by the end of probation.  If revoked, by DOC, out of up to 25% prison funds.  Any balance as a condition of probation. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
*Restitution set at zero.
Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
NO contact with the victim Michael J. and coactors R.J., Jermaine Greer, D.K., T.J., Shatavia Joiner, D.J., S.J., J.P.

Court finds defendant  was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdmeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: Forthwith.  Huber privileges for school and treatment.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin L Delaney

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin L Delaney in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:

*As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant to serve 90 condition days in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges for school and treatment.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Michael J. and Co-actors:  R.J., Jermaine Greer, D.K., T.J., Shatavia Joiner, D.J., S.J., J.P.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Restitution is set at $0 (zero).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation. If revoked, by DOC, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

Defendant Kevin L Delaney in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's List of Possible Witnesses filed.

Defendant Kevin L Delaney in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  James C. Griffin for Tyrone St. Junior II appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests Jury trial.   Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kevin L Delaney in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea hearing. Defense request adjourned hearing for plea and sentencing. Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing, Br 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Kevin L Delaney in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Kevin L Delaney in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Patrick Winter practicing under the student practice rule under the supervision of Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Michael J.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kevin L Delaney in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  
Defendant Kevin L Delaney in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to the Misdemeanor Count. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
